reviews.sentence: Not quite what we expected. We stayed here because we have stayed in the Four Point brand before and been pleased and because it is across the street and walking distance from Kaufman Field and we were in for game 6 of the ALCSIt turned out OK the rooms were comfortable enough the beds actually really comfy but I would describe the property as quite spartan. It is just the basics and not much more. There is a restaurant bar of sorts but as we discovered the hard way it is open for breakfast until 0930 but closed all day until 170 honestly the KC Sports Complex and this hotel is in the middle of absolutely nowhere you can see downtown KC about 10 miles away to the west. we did not have a rental car and you can not even get lunch at your hotelThe staff were very friendly but we were shocked at the lack of anything close by really there is nothing and do not be fooled by the Caseys sports bar ads from across the street advertised as open all day it is not same hours as the Four Point bar ie closed all day until 160. The only food available is at a Denys kitty corner at yet another hotel which is alright I guess but you want a beer with your lunch. ya no. the Denys is not licensed and full of little kids so mid day lunch on game day game 6 of the ALCS. hundreds if not thousands of out of town fans and there is not a beer within miles. Just not at all what we expected. Not sure what I would recommend if you are an out of towner going to KC for a big game but I would not stay at this property again.

Will return. Have stayed here twice. Once for a Royals game and once for a Chiefs game. Both stays were great. The first time we stay we just went to the game and stayed over night. So we were not there long. This last time we stayed the night before so we checked out the bar. it is a nice little place but the food was cold when it came out. The bar staff also seemed a little uncaring and did not move very fast. I would not knock the hotel on that though as it seemed to be ran by an individual contractor or something like that. The beds at the hotel are always soft and very comfortable. I will stay here when ever I am going to a game.

Handy for games. The hotel was ok but in 3 days we only had one opportunity to eat there. The hours for the restaurant were too limited had to walk 20 mins cross busy highways to get food. Not impressed by that.

Great hotel for the price. The hotel was really nice and the bed was very comfy. Staff was friendly and courteous and we enjoyed our stay despite only staying one night. I did not like that breakfast was not included with our room. All other hotels I have stayed in have provided at the very least a cold breakfast for free. Many of them now give a hot breakfast for free to their guests. I would have very much liked to have had a free hot breakfast rather than having to pay for it.

Affordable for quick overnight stay. Rooms were nice remodeled and comfortable and the price was very very good as Royals were out of town hotel is across street from stadium. Location is convenient for getting on interstate but not for walking outside. Gym was adequate indoor pool is huge. However hotel needs some more work key cards frequently failed a staff member barged in one day unannounced strong stench of marijuana in hallway. one morning lobby needs remodeling cafe is comically slow and incompetent. Yet far better than far more expensive grungier Days Inn down the road in Blue Springs. We appreciated the savings and clean rooms but hotel needs better management.

Did the job but a little pricey for what it had. It was walking distance to Kaufman Stadium. Even though not much around the location it was only a couple of miles to restaurants and entertainment. Wish they had breakfast in the morning you did not have to pay for. Although a decent stay could use a few upgrades and repairs especially for what it cost to stay.

Poor service. This was quite possibly the worst check in experience I have ever had. Individual at the check in counter was unpleasant and seemed extremely unhappy to be there. Only one person was working in the breakfast area despite a substantial crowd. This place is extremely poorly managed.

Customer service was horrendous from the front desk to the sports bar. Room were not ready when we arrived. Waited 3 plus hour for room. Buffet was ridiculously bad for 125. No plates or cups were available for the buffet and no attendant were around and to ask questions. In the showers the shower head were so low it was spraying into my belly. Overall a very bad experience when trying to enjoy a baseball weekend with my family.

Poor. The bed was comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. Dirty lobby dirty elevators dirty hallways basically run down and shabby all over. Definitely NOT worth 300 per night. More like a 75 a night or less. Bathroom was minuscule. Not sure what the “ Deluxe ” meant for the upcharge on my room. Old dated room with a bed tv desk and a hideous red stained couch. I ’ve stayed in a nicer Motel 6 room. Went to eat in the “ restaurant bar ” no wait staff no service finally left and walked across the parking lot t Taco Bell. Nasty partially eaten food left on trays in the lobby near the coffee service. Was there for hours. Nothing in area other than the Stadiums. Not up to Sheraton standards.

The hotel is as convenient as any for visitors to Arrowhead or Kaufman Stadium. It is literally right across the street from both. The room was clean but there were a few things that bugged me. First of all there was a really loud plumbing noise at various times. Sometimes as often as every 30 minutes. And the poor bartender at their bar had so many things wrong out of her control that I could not help but feel bad for her. The cooler barely kept the beer cold so she had to keep them in ice. Some of the TVs were not working. But the bartender and staff here are all nice no complaints there. The other things that annoyed me were much more minor. The toilet barely worked. The garbage cans did not have garbage bags. And there was a button missing on their soap dispenser in the shower. I am not sure I would chose here again.
everthing was good no problems enjoyed our stay very much breakfast in the morning was excelant.
Very clean comfortable and spacious room. Great dealThe free breakfast was excellent.

Stayed two nights Saturday Sept 21st though Sept 23. Everything was fantastic. Went to a Chiefs game and was an easy walk to the stadium and back. Great free breakfast. Everybody was very friendly and the rooms were wonderful. Will definitely stay again.
Great rooms fine pool adult oriented breakfast no waffles or cereal for kids.

Spent New Years Eve at BWP formerly Sheraton Four Points for a party in the ballroom had a great time ushering out the old year and bringing in the new one with old friends and family. Met some new friends and rekindled some old friendships. The hotel staff and accommodating were extremely great. The rooms had been recently remodeled which the only complaint I would bring up is I could not get the balcony sliding door to open. The complementary breakfast buffet was fresh plentiful and delicious.

Staff was great. Clean rooms. We enjoyed the evenings in the restaurant bar lots of TVs folks were super friendly great service. The free breakfast was very good. The first morning we were there the front desk made an error and told us breakfast went until 11 but when we got there at 1030 they had shut it down. the gal in the restaurant did not say a negative word she quickly grabbed food for our kids and was super sweet too often when glitches happen employees back talk coworkers and it was cool to see they worked as a team and know mistakes happen. Only bummer was some of the guests staying there at the same time a few complete slobs no nice way to say it spilling not picking up after themselves letting their kids mark up the walls jump on furniture and very demanding to the staff. Even through the rudeness and tackiness of some of the guests the hotel staff stayed friendly and accommodating. We mainly stayed here because we were going to a Chiefs game and it was a great choice. The walk to the game was about 10 minutes and so the free parking at the hotel worked out awesome.
AFC Championship Titans Fan. Perfect location and convenience to stadiums Breakfast and Bar area A. Very awesome staff.
Wonderful. Breakfast. Slept well great staff and Breakfast.

Lovely staff comfortable and clean room and a nice breakfast. Thank you. The lady at the front desk was so sweet and accommodating. The bed was comfortable and breakfast was very nice. We had a lovely stay. I thought there was a hot tub in the pool area. I believe I read the description wrong so it is no ones fault.

Lovely staff comfortable and clean room and a nice breakfast. Thank you. The lady at the front desk was so sweet and accommodating. The bed was comfortable and breakfast was very nice. We had a lovely stay. I thought there was a hot tub in the pool area. I believe I read the description wrong so it is no ones fault.
